Description:
Neat unit in the heart of Croydon.
Positioned within walking distance to Croydon Central offering a full range of amenities with Swinburne TAFE only steps away, shops, cafes, railway station and tranquil parks, this desirable brick-veneer home is quietly set back from the road and presents a superb opportunity for the first-home buyer, investor, downsizer or retiree.
Occupying a generous 294m2 (approx.) block and greeted by an appealing portico entry, step inside and be surprised by the homely interior. The lounge feels comfortable and relaxed, further enhanced with lashings of natural light entering through the large window.
The spacious kitchen provides everything you need and is a pleasure to work in. Eye-catching stainless steel appliances include an electric oven and gas stove, while the De'Longhi dishwasher is an appreciable benefit. The tiled splashback adds practicality to the space, in addition to ample storage and benchtops which make cooking a breeze. Furthermore, the sizable adjoining dining area connects with the paved outdoor entertaining zone through double glass doors.
The master features a walk-in robe and ensuite-effect bathroom incorporating a bath, shower and separate toilet. Bedroom two comprises a double built-in robe while bedroom three is fitted with double sliding doors to open up the space if required.
Offering a full-sized laundry, this delightful home also features linen and storage cupboards, gas ducted heating, remote-entry single garage with internal access and visitor parking out front. The secure backyard is above average in size for a unit while still being low in maintenance, offering a remarkable opportunity to spend time outdoors.
Adjoining the Carrum-Warburton Trail and positioned opposite the Fred Geale Oval, this property is just a short walk from Arndale Civic Shopping Centre, Tarralla Creek, Croydon Gums Kindergarten, Dorset Primary School, Ruskin Park Primary School, Croydon Memorial Pool, as well as being a brief drive from Croydon Railway Station, EastLink freeway, The Good Shepherd Primary School, Tintern Grammar, bicycle track, hospitals, cafes and restaurants.
Croydon is currently undergoing major development growth with significant spending on local infrastructure that is likely to fuel property price and rental demand. One such project is the expansion of Croydon Central, introducing a new market food hall, new essential services, additional parking, upgraded children's play equipment, undercover walkway from Croydon Railway Station in addition to twenty new town terraces.
Positioned at the rear of a beautifully presented complex, everything you need is right here.

Furthermore, this appealing residence features a double garage with remote roller door, gated driveway access, a water tank and landscaped gardens that encourage your attention to the outdoors.

Description:
The ease of Croydon Central living.
An urban lifestyle is one of the many benefits that this solid, brick-veneer unit has to offer, positioned in Croydon Central to enjoy instant access to shops, cafes, cinemas, train station, parks and every conceivable convenience.
Set back from the road and enjoying a peaceful environment, this single-level, two-bedroom unit is set in a small, well-maintained complex and affords a low maintenance lifestyle. Step inside and you're immediately greeted by the comfortable lounge perfect for reclining with family and friends.
The neutral tones and timber accents are repeated throughout while large windows attract plenty of natural light. The kitchen also feels light and bright, incorporating the meals area, as well as featuring an electric oven and stove.
Positioned off a quiet hallway, the master comprises a double built-in robe and offers privacy away from bedroom two. The central bathroom/Euro laundry is easily accessible, while other highlights of the home include; split system heating and cooling, floating floor, carpet and single carport.
This residence is situated within close walking distance to Croydon Park, Hewish Road Child Care Centre, Croydon Primary School, Ruskin Park Primary School, Swinburne TAFE, bus stop, Croydon Memorial Pool, tennis courts, as well as being just a short drive from The Good Shepherd Primary School, Melba College, hospitals, BMX tracks, libraries and EastLink freeway.
Croydon is currently undergoing major development growth with significant spending on local infrastructure that is likely to fuel property price and rental demand. One such project is the expansion of Croydon Central, introducing a new market food hall, new essential services, additional parking, upgraded children's play equipment, undercover walkway from Croydon Railway Station in addition to twenty new town terraces.
Currently leased to a long term tenant, this is a superb opportunity for and investor or of course the first-home seeker, retiree and downsizer to take advantage of this brilliant location. We recommend immediate action.
